elements.desc:
`paper-menu-button` allows one to compose a designated "trigger" element with
another element that represents "content", to create a dropdown menu that
displays the "content" when the "trigger" is clicked.

The child element with the class `dropdown-trigger` will be used as the
"trigger" element. The child element with the class `dropdown-content` will be
used as the "content" element.

The `paper-menu-button` is sensitive to its content's `iron-select` events. If
the "content" element triggers an `iron-select` event, the `paper-menu-button`
will close automatically.

Example:

    <paper-menu-button>
      <paper-icon-button icon="menu" class="dropdown-trigger"></paper-icon-button>
      <paper-menu class="dropdown-content">
        <paper-item>Share</paper-item>
        <paper-item>Settings</paper-item>
        <paper-item>Help</paper-item>
      </paper-menu>
    </paper-menu-button>

### Styling

The following custom properties and mixins are also available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--paper-menu-button-dropdown-background` | Background color of the paper-menu-button dropdown | `#fff`
`--paper-menu-button` | Mixin applied to the paper-menu-button | `{}`
`--paper-menu-button-disabled` | Mixin applied to the paper-menu-button when disabled | `{}`
`--paper-menu-button-dropdown` | Mixin applied to the paper-menu-button dropdown | `{}`

jsdoc.orig:
*
       * Fired when the dropdown closes.
       *
       * @event paper-dropdown-close

*
       * Fired when the dropdown opens.
       *
       * @event paper-dropdown-open

properties.name: addOwnKeyBinding
properties.desc:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

properties.name: close
properties.desc: Hide the dropdown content.

properties.name: closeAnimationConfig
properties.desc:
An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the
closing of the dropdown.

properties.name: contentElement
properties.desc: The content element that is contained by the menu button, if any.

properties.name: disabled
properties.desc: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

properties.name: focused
properties.desc: If true, the element currently has focus.

properties.name: horizontalAlign
properties.desc:
The orientation against which to align the menu dropdown
horizontally relative to the dropdown trigger.

properties.name: horizontalOffset
properties.desc:
A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `horizontalAlign`. Use a negative value to offset to the
left, or a positive value to offset to the right.

properties.name: ignoreSelect
properties.desc:
Set to true to disable automatically closing the dropdown after
a selection has been made.

properties.name: keyEventTarget
properties.desc: The HTMLElement that will be firing relevant KeyboardEvents.

properties.name: noAnimations
properties.desc:
Set to true to disable animations when opening and closing the
dropdown.

properties.name: open
properties.desc:
Make the dropdown content appear as an overlay positioned relative
to the dropdown trigger.

properties.name: openAnimationConfig
properties.desc:
An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the
opening of the dropdown.

properties.name: opened
properties.desc: True if the content is currently displayed.

properties.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
properties.desc: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.desc:
The orientation against which to align the menu dropdown
vertically relative to the dropdown trigger.

properties.name: verticalOffset
properties.desc:
A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `verticalAlign`. Use a negative value to offset towards the
top, or a positive value to offset towards the bottom.

properties.name: _disabledChanged
properties.desc:
If the dropdown is open when disabled becomes true, close the
dropdown.

properties.name: _dropdownContent
properties.desc:
This is the element intended to be bound as the focus target
for the `iron-dropdown` contained by `paper-menu-button`.

properties.name: _imperativeKeyBindings
properties.desc: own properties of everything on the "prototype".

properties.name: _onIronSelect
properties.desc:
When an `iron-select` event is received, the dropdown should
automatically close on the assumption that a value has been chosen.

params.name: event
params.desc:
A CustomEvent instance with type
set to `"iron-select"`.

properties.name: _openedChanged
properties.desc:
When the dropdown opens, the `paper-menu-button` fires `paper-open`.
When the dropdown closes, the `paper-menu-button` fires `paper-close`.

params.name: opened
params.desc: True if the dropdown is opened, otherwise false.

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: complete
properties.desc: Called when the animation finishes.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

paper-menu-button.desc:
`paper-menu-button` allows one to compose a designated "trigger" element with
another element that represents "content", to create a dropdown menu that
displays the "content" when the "trigger" is clicked.

The child element with the class `dropdown-trigger` will be used as the
"trigger" element. The child element with the class `dropdown-content` will be
used as the "content" element.

The `paper-menu-button` is sensitive to its content's `iron-select` events. If
the "content" element triggers an `iron-select` event, the `paper-menu-button`
will close automatically.

Example:

    <paper-menu-button>
      <paper-icon-button icon="menu" class="dropdown-trigger"></paper-icon-button>
      <paper-menu class="dropdown-content">
        <paper-item>Share</paper-item>
        <paper-item>Settings</paper-item>
        <paper-item>Help</paper-item>
      </paper-menu>
    </paper-menu-button>

### Styling

The following custom properties and mixins are also available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--paper-menu-button-dropdown-background` | Background color of the paper-menu-button dropdown | `#fff`
`--paper-menu-button` | Mixin applied to the paper-menu-button | `{}`
`--paper-menu-button-disabled` | Mixin applied to the paper-menu-button when disabled | `{}`
`--paper-menu-button-dropdown` | Mixin applied to the paper-menu-button dropdown | `{}`
